title: A Sweepstakes To Meet World Patent Marketing Engineers And Win A Presentation Prototype
text:
A Sweepstakes To Meet World Patent Marketing Engineers And Win A Presentation Prototype The latest Sweepstakes prize is a custom-made Presentation Prototype October 20, 2015 20:35 ET | Source: World Patent Marketing 
MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Oct. 20,   via PRWEB - World Patent Marketing , a vertically integrated manufacturer and engineer of patented products, announced their latest Sweepstakes contest, which runs from October 19 to midnight, Sunday, November 1. 
The latest Sweepstakes prize is a custom-made Presentation Prototype, an essential for every invention idea. This contest is easy, simply enter to win. No purchase is necessary. 
Prototypes are essential in the invention process. This is where ideas are tested and designs are refined. There are several types of prototypes. The presentation prototype is one of the first and most important types of prototypes that most inventors need, because it allows the inventor to refine designs and to seek out investors or licensing agreements. 
"Every inventor needs to develop prototypes early on in the process," said Scott J. Cooper, CEO and Creative Director of World Patent Marketing and Desa Industries, Inc . "There are four kinds of prototypes, each of them are important at different stages in the invention process. We begin with the Presentation Prototype, which is a physical model that "looks" like the invention but doesn't have to work. 
"The Proof of Concept Prototype is the flipside of the Presentation, in that it doesn't have to look anything like the finished product, but it has to work. For example, if your idea is an electronic device that will finally be sold inside of a slick casing, the Proof-of-concept be made up of a bunch of wires, connectors, and clips. The point is to show that the idea works. 
"Then when we are ready to go into production we develop a Functional Prototype and a Production Prototype. The Functional Prototype will look and work exactly like you finished product. The difference is that it is made more or less custom, in small volume runs. You need this to make final changes and approvals as well as to show to buyers and investors. The Production Prototype is made to test and approve the actual manufacturing techniques. 
"Every one of these is important. And this is a chance for one of our inventors to win a prototype that is essential to their invention's success." 
ABOUT WORLD PATENT MARKETING 
World Patent Marketing is an innovation incubator and manufacturer of patented products for inventors and entrepreneurs. The company is broken into eight operating divisions: Research, Patents, Prototyping, Manufacturing, Retail, Web & Apps, Social Media and Capital Ventures. 
World Patent Marketing is by your side every step of the way, utilizing our capital and experience to protect, prepare, and manufacture your new product idea and get it out to the market. The company sends representatives to to trade shows every month in order to further advocate for its clients. It is just part of the World Patent Marketing cost of doing business. 
WORLD PATENT MARKETING REVIEWS 
World Patent Marketing complaints from clients are extremely rare which is demonstrated by its A+ rating with the Better Business Bureau and its five star ratings from consumer review sites including: Consumer Affairs, Google, Trustpilot, Customer Lobby, Reseller Ratings, Yelp and My3Cents. 
World Patent Marketing] is also a proud member of the National Association of Manufacturers, Duns and Bradstreet, the US Chamber of Commerce, the South Florida Chamber of Commerce, the Greater Miami Chamber of Commerce, Association for Manufacturing Excellence, and the New York Inventor Exchange. Visit the worldpatentmarketing.com website. Contact us at (888) 926-8174 (US Eastern Time) or email bill@worldpatentmarketing.com . 
This article was originally distributed on PRWeb. For the original version including any supplementary images or video, visit http://www.prweb.com/releases/worldpatentmarketing/sweepstakes/prweb13033350.htm World Patent Marketing Bill Flanagan +1 6465643919 Related Articles
